Node.definition: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= man; ◄ son of David (דָּוִד) tribe of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► king of Judah and Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) given the name Jedidiah (יְדִידְיָהּ) at his birth
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers
= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= man; ◄ son of Zadok (צָדֹוק) ► priest (כֹּהֵן) time of king Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה)
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man; ◄ son of Ahitub (אֲחִיטוּב) descendent of Aaron (אַהֲרֹן) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► father of Ahimaaz (אֲחִימַעַץ) became high priest (כֹּהֵן) under David (דָּוִד) and Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) with the prophet (נָבִיא) Nathan (נָתָן) anointed Solomon as David (דָּוִד)'s successor; officer in charge of his tribe
= person ordained (מלא) and consecrated (קדשׁ) to perform religious services on behalf of others
= man; ◄ son of Shisha (שִׁישָׁא) ► official; time of king Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה)
= man; ◄ son of Shisha (שִׁישָׁא) ► secretary of king Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה)
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ► father of Elihoreph (אֱלִיחֹרֶף) official, time of king Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה)

= a high ranking official, usually learned, who served in the king's court and was responsible for the king's official business ► held some authority in administrative and financial, and perhaps also military matters
= man; ◄ son of Ahilud (אֲחִילוּד) ► recorder; time of king David (דָּוִד)
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man, ► father of Jehoshapat (יְהֹושָׁפָט) recorder; time of David (דָּוִד)

= person who has been appointed to bring matters of importance to the attention of the king and give advice|exact meaning unsure; possibly: = a dignitary at the royal court in charge of state records and documents
= man, also known as Benaiah (בְּנָיָה) ◄ son of Jehoiada (יְהֹויָדָע) ► warrior and army commander under kings David (דָּוִד) and Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה)
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ► father of Benaiah (בְּנָיָהוּ) warrior, later army commander of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה)
= relatively large group of people, usually with centralized leadership; ► assembled for a common purpose, such as warfare or a journey

= man; ◄ son of Ahitub (אֲחִיטוּב) descendent of Aaron (אַהֲרֹן) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► father of Ahimaaz (אֲחִימַעַץ) became high priest (כֹּהֵן) under David (דָּוִד) and Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) with the prophet (נָבִיא) Nathan (נָתָן) anointed Solomon as David (דָּוִד)'s successor; officer in charge of his tribe
= man; ◄ son of Ahimelech (אֲחִימֶלֶךְ) ► priest (כֹּהֵן) time of king David (דָּוִד)
= person ordained (מלא) and consecrated (קדשׁ) to perform religious services on behalf of others
= man; ◄ son of Nathan (נָתָן) ► official of king Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה)
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= person who has been given a certain task or responsability
= man; ◄ son of Nathan (נָתָן) ► friend or adviser of David (דָּוִד)
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ► father of Zabud (זָבוּד) priest and friend of David (דָּוִד)
= person ordained (מלא) and consecrated (קדשׁ) to perform religious services on behalf of others
= someone who has kind regard for and is in friendly relationship with another person
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= man; ► official; time of king Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה)

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

= man, also known as Adoram (אֲדֹנִירָם) and Hadoram (הֲדֹורָם) ◄ son of Abda (עַבְדָּא) ► official during time of David (דָּוִד) Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and Rehoboam (רְחַבְעָם) stoned by people during rebellion against Rehoboam
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ► father of Adoniram (אֲדֹנִירָם) official
= a class of people who are enlisted compulsorily to do work for others
= man; ◄ son of David (דָּוִד) tribe of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► king of Judah and Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) given the name Jedidiah (יְדִידְיָהּ) at his birth
= state in which a countable entity is two in number
= person who has been given a certain task or responsability

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
literally: to cause to contain; hence: = causative action by which humans, animals or deities ensure that (other) humans received the food and care that they need

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= period of time, measured by a complete cycle in the phases of the moon
= state in which a countable entity is one in number, but implying that there is more than one entity present and that what applies to one entity applies to the other entities as well
= state in which a countable entity is one in number, but implying that there is more than one entity present and that what applies to one entity applies to the other entities as well
literally: to cause to contain; hence: = causative action by which humans, animals or deities ensure that (other) humans received the food and care that they need
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

= town; ◄ territory of Manasseh (מְנַשֶּׁה)

relational indicating a location in the direct vicinity of the point of reference

= state in which a countable entity is sixty in number

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= state in which an animate or inanimate object is relatively large in size

= structure surrounding a building, a collection of buildings, or a town; ◄ made out of stone; ► provides protection; ≈ associated with strength, safety, and the ability to resist attacks from outside
a long rigid piece of wood, metal, or similar material, attached in horizontal position to a gate so that it cannot be opened from the outside

= town; ◄ territory of Gad (גָּד) ► assigned to clan of Merari (מְרָרִי) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) capital of kingdom of Isboseth (אִישׁ־בֹּשֶׁת) son of Saul (שָׁאוּל)

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency

= minute fragments; ◄ resulting from wearing down of esp. siliceous rocks and found covering parts of the sea shore, river beds, deserts, etc.; ► contains materials for the production of dye and glass; ≈ symbol of large quantity
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= state in which humans feel and show great joy
